main event: A shiny object was observed in the sky in Colorado Springs on February 28, 1953.
interesting points: The object was described as dull and shiny, observed 60Â° above the eastern horizon., The observation lasted for 1.5 hours., The object appeared stationary before drifting., The sighting was reported by an unknown reliability source., No photographs were taken or obtained during the observation.
